gobblin.metrics.example

Class ReporterExampleBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.metrics.example.ReporterExampleBase

  • public class ReporterExampleBase
extends Object
    A base class for those that exemplifies the usage of MetricContext and a given ContextAwareScheduledReporter.

    This class simulating a record processing job that spawns a configurable number of tasks running in a thread pool for processing incoming data records in parallel. Each task will simulate processing the same configurable number of records. The job creates a job-level MetricContext, from which a child MetricContext for each task is created. Each task uses four metrics in its MetricContext to keep track of the total number of records processed, record processing rate, record size distribution, and record processing times. Since the job-level MetricContext is the parent of the MetricContexts of the tasks, updates to a metric of a task will be automatically applied to the metric with the same name in the job-level MetricContext. The job and task MetricContexts use the same given ContextAwareScheduledReporter to report metrics.
